emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Evolution
emerging_technologies.description: AI tools evolve from code completion to autonomously writing, testing, and deploying software, incorporating real-time learning from code repositories and user interactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces coding skill barriers, impacts job markets, increases efficiency but raises concerns about intellectual property and human creativity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires high-quality datasets, advanced AI ethics frameworks, and regulatory acceptance for autonomous development systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Enhanced Reality
emerging_technologies.description: Development of neural interfaces that enhance AR/VR experiences by directly interpreting and influencing brain activity.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for deep personalization of experiences, privacy concerns regarding mental privacy, and ethical use of cognitive enhancement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial costs, need for extensive user testing, and regulatory approval for neural interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport Networks
emerging_technologies.description: Integration of self-driving cars into urban transport systems, optimized through AI for traffic flow and energy efficiency.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Decreases accidents, reduces urban congestion, but increases reliance on technology and raises data security issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory frameworks, public trust in autonomous systems, and infrastructure readiness.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Extraction
emerging_technologies.description: Mining and processing of resources on celestial bodies like asteroids and moons for use on Earth or in space habitats.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential economic boom, environmental considerations in space, geopolitical space governance issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in robotics, economic viability, and international cooperation or competition.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Grids
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain technology to manage peer-to-peer energy trading, enhancing grid resilience and promoting renewable energy use.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Empowers local energy production, reduces reliance on centralized energy systems, but requires significant infrastructure changes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, technological integration with existing grids, consumer education.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Software Development
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that not only assist in coding but also manage entire development cycles, from planning to deployment.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in software companies, with significant improvements in productivity and code quality.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Public Transportation
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous buses and shuttles operating in urban environments, integrated with smart city infrastructure.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming the norm in forward-thinking cities, reducing the need for human drivers and optimizing transport efficiency.

epoch_themes.description: The shift towards AI systems that not only assist but also autonomously perform complex tasks.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transforming job markets, necessitating new educational approaches, and raising ethical questions about AI decision-making.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in AI research, global AI ethics guidelines, and AI-driven automation in various sectors.

epoch_themes.description: Technological advancements aimed at making urban environments more sustainable and livable.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improved urban air quality, reduced carbon footprints, and new forms of urban mobility.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urbanization, green initiatives, and the rise of smart cities worldwide.
